title: Longitude, Navigation, and Timekeeping
description: The state of navigation prior to 1800 and the world wide problem of determining longitude at sea. Emphasis on historical and modern-day scientific solutions to the longitude problem and navigation technology, time and timekeeping, celestial navigation, and awareness of technological solutions to societal problems. 4 lectures. Fulfills GE Area F.
prerequisites: Junior standing and completion of GE Area B, MATH 119 or equivalent
